description: Led a team of four in the design, architecture, and implementation of a feature that reduced system downtime by 20% caused by disk failures

Spearheaded the design, architecture, and implementation of a feature that optimizes disk-to-memory space allocation, preventing downsizing and minimizing wasted space on physical disks, resulting in a 50% increase in storage capacity

Collaborated with the development team to identify critical RAID processes and their dependencies, ensuring comprehensive test coverage for essential functionalities, and improving the reliability and resilience of the RAID subsystem
Engineered a disk configuration optimizer for ONTAP System Manager that provides real-time recommendations for RAID layouts based on workload analysis
Delivered end-to-end implementation, including backend APIs (Python/C++), SQL-based data persistence, automated testing frameworks, and frontend integration, increasing system efficiency by 5%
Contributed to NetApp's distributed storage platform serving enterprise customers with petabyte-scale storage requirements
Led review sessions, office hours, and developed practice problems for over 500 students.
Assisted in CS 354 (C Programming and Computer Systems) course.
Led review sessions, office hours, and developed practice problems for over 500 students.
Developed and maintained integrations on DoIT's enterprise integration platform, supporting campus-wide services and infrastructure
Migrated legacy integrations to cloud-native technologies following modern best practices
Collaborated with campus partners to document business requirements and translate them into technical integration solutions
Provided end-user support and contributed to internal and external documentation
